intro: Homalium griffithianum var. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth homalium, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous bark and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are often followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
